cox.summary <- function(fit) {
  cat("Cox model summary:")
  fit %>%
    finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE) %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "Variable",
        "HR",
        "Lower 95%",
        "Upper 95%",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()

  cat("\\newline

Diagnostics: \\newline

")

  cat("\\newline

::: {.panel-tabset}

      ")

  cat("

###### Proportional hazards assumption test \\newline

  ")
  cox.zph(fit)$table %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "",
        "Chi-squared statistic",
        "DF",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()

  cat("\\newline

###### DF betas \\newline

  ")

  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "dfbeta"))

  cat("\\newline

###### Martingale residuals \\newline

      ")

  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "martingale", linear.predictions = TRUE))

  cat("\\newline

:::

      ")
  return()
}


GetHR <- function(fit, var) {
  # Get point estimate with 95% CI

  HR.dat <- summary(fit)$conf.int %>%
    as.data.frame() %>%
    filter(rownames(summary(fit)$conf.int) %in% var) %>%
    select(`exp(coef)`, `lower .95`, `upper .95`)
  # Ensure variables are in the same order as var
  HR.dat <- HR.dat[var, ]
  # Add p-value
  HR.dat$p <- summary(fit)$coefficients[var, "p"]
  names(HR.dat) <- c("HR", "Lower95", "Upper95", "p")
  HR.dat
}

This page describes associations between demographic data and time-to-flare. Sex
and IMD are not covered here as they are covered in the
[controlled variables section](Controlled.qmd)

The page describing demographic variables in a descriptive manner can be found
[here](../Baseline/Demographics.qmd).

## Age

### Crohn's disease

::: {.panel-tabset group="followup"}

#### Patient-reported flare

```{R}
#| results: "hold"
#| output: "asis"
#| fig-height: 6.5
flare.cd.df$Agecat <- cut(flare.cd.df$Age,
  c(0, 18, 30, 45, 65, Inf),
  labels = c("< 18", "18-29", "30-44", "45-64", ">=65"),
  right = FALSE
)


fit <- survfit(Surv(softflare_time, softflare) ~ Agecat,
  data = flare.cd.df
)

p <- ggsurvplot(fit,
  data = flare.cd.df,
  conf.int = TRUE,
  pval = TRUE,
  pval.method = TRUE,
  ggtheme = theme_minimal(),
  risk.table = TRUE,
  legend.title = "Age",
  palette = c("#1A8FE3", "#E76D83", "#5FB49C", "#FED766", "green"),
  xlab = "Time from study recrutiment (days)",
  title = "Time to clinical flare",
  break.time.by = 200
)

cairo_pdf("plots/cd/soft-flare/demographics/age.pdf")
p
invisible(dev.off())

png("plots/cd/soft-flare/demographics/age.png",
  width = 7,
  height = 7,
  units = "in",
  res = 300
)
p
invisible(dev.off())

p


fit.me <- coxph(
  Surv(softflare_time, softflare) ~
    Sex + IMD + cat + Age + frailty(SiteNo),
  control = coxph.control(outer.max = 20),
  data = flare.cd.df
)


cd.clin.forest <- rbind(cd.clin.forest,
                        GetHR(fit.me, "Age"))

invisible(cox.summary(fit.me))
```
